Your Committee further recognizes the potential impacts of these actions on people in Hawaii, including increased costs and adverse consequences for families and businesses. Accordingly, your Committee recommends that the Judiciary budget be amended by providing an additional $1,000,000 for civil legal services and $750,000 for legal services to individuals in immigration-related court proceedings. Your Committee has amended this measure by: (1) Increasing the appropriation for Administration (JUD601) by $1,750,000; (2) Providing for an unspecified sum to be expended by Administration (JUD601) for civil legal services; (3) Providing for

Your Committee finds that the appropriations made by this measure will assist the Judiciary in its efforts to fulfill its constitutional, statutory, and public service duties. Your Committee respectfully requests your Committee on Finance, should it deliberate on this measure, to consider authorizing $7,000,000 in lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects for Judiciary facilities to account for the additional cost of $2,000,000 to relocate the Children's Justice Center. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs that is attached to

its efforts to fulfill its constitutional, statutory, and public service duties. Your Committee respectfully requests your Committee on Finance, should it deliberate on this measure, to consider authorizing $7,000,000 in lump sum general obligation bond funds for capital improvement projects for Judiciary facilities to account for the additional cost of $2,000,000 to relocate the Children's Justice Center. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 400 and recommends that it pass Second
